title: CYSEC CTF 2022 walkthrough
snippet: PREFACEThis is a write up on the national cysec ctf So i decided i’ll be writing on challenges that i solved first during the competition, when i’m a little less busy i’ll make a writeup on other c...
content: PREFACEThis is a write up on the national cysec ctf So i decided i’ll be writing on challenges that i solved first during the competition, when i’m a little less busy i’ll make a writeup on other challenges.WebBreadcrumbsWhat do they say about cookies?No need for brute forcing pleasehttp://34.205.69.93:3000/nice, let’s open the link http://34.205.69.93:3000/hmm we got this! let’s check things we can find, so i decided to scan around manally and see functions that are available clicked on the Auth dropdowni decided to register to see what happenshmm nothing much just thislet’s try to login let’s see what happenslogged in got into the dashboard, since the dashboard was talking about cookies, decided to check out my cookies i found out it’s base64..then tried to decrypt, got my username and passwordtried submitting my cookies, sighs* here’s what i gotas i was taking notes of possible endpoints, decided to check out other functionalitiesoh! yeah it was the support’s time let’s check out supporthmm it says “where will you like to steal cookies from” and it also says “tell us where we can reach you”.. so i thought why dont you check out the request sent to me..so i lit up my ngrokNgrok is a cross-platform application that helps you serve your local ports to the internet. to get one you can just download it fromhereso i used this command to lit it up┌─[nerdy@genii]─[~]└──╼ $ngrok http 8000ngrok: name of the tool'http' argument tells the tool to start an http tunnel so you can receive the http request sent8000 tells it to send the request to port 8000then i set up my netcat to listen on port 8000 with this command┌─[nerdy@parrot]─[~]└──╼ $nc -lnvp 8000nc: name of the tool-lnvp is the same as -l -n -v -p-l tells it to listen-n tells it numeric-only IP addresses, no DNS-p tells it what port to listen oni filled the form up the form with my detailssubmitted and waited for the request from support and boom!! the request came with a cookieso let’s submit it, i logged in and put the cookiesubmitted………..and…yayyy!! it was correct and we got our flagyeah that’s all about Breadcrumbs, nice right? will drop the remaining when i’m less busy..thanks for reading, ありがとうございました (Arigatōgozaimashita)
